reviewText: This episode follows the usual manner of other Midsomer murders. Two women are murdered in an unusual manner, exactly as described in a mystery novel by a man who everybody knows has been dead for three years. The women are unrelated and as far as everybody knows, did not know one another. A manuscript is found by the dead writer which no one knew existed. The dead writers widow states she examined everything when her husband died and there was no manuscript. Then a man is murdered. Barnaby and his sergeant need to investigate. What is the connection between the people? Why were they killed? Is the found manuscript a true document composed by the dead writer? There are many red herrings.
